lead_paragraph: Two black students, employing YouTube videos and a hashtag, started a campaign to expose what they see as a hostile climate at Boston Latin School, a beacon of high achievement that was founded in 1635.

headline.print_headline: Students Say Racial Hostilities Simmered at a Beacon of High Achievement in Boston
headline.main: Students Say Racial Hostilities Simmered at Historic Boston Latin School

snippet: Two black students, employing YouTube videos and a hashtag, started a campaign to expose what they see as a hostile climate at Boston Latin School, a beacon of high achievement that was founded in 1635.
abstract: Boston Latin School lands in middle of discrimination discussion when black students Meggie Noel and Kylie Webster-Cazeau launch social media campaign to shed light on school culture where online hate speech and racial slurs receive little disciplinary action; headmaster Lynne Mooney Teta announces series of steps to address racial hostility and create cultural awareness within school.
